intro: Erigeron japonicus, commonly known as Japanese fleabane, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features silvery-gray foliage with finely divided leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing white to pale blue ray florets and yellow disk florets. It is often found in open, sunny areas such as meadows and rocky slopes.
